729012f-a.folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY

729013f-c.text:
(1)
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billop House, or "Conference House." In this house was held the famous conference between a committee representing the Continental Congress, consisting of Benjamin Franklin, John Adams, and Edward Rutledge and Admiral Lord Howe. The house derives its name from Christopher Billopp.
About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the rear of the house.
1924
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A front view of the house.
September 19, 1925
P. I. Sperr

729014f-b.text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billop House, or "Conference House." In this house was held, on September 11, 1776, a conference between Benjamin Franklin, John Adams, and Edward Rutledge representing the Continental Congress and Admiral Lord Howe, commanding the British naval forces. The house derives its name from Christopher Billop, who circumnavigated Staten Island in less than twenty-fomr hours and claimed it for Nev York State.

About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

(2)
The baement kitchen of the Billopp House.

About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

729014f-a.folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY

729015f-a.text:
BILLOPP HOUSE  Hylan Boulevard and Satterlee Street, Tottenville, Staten Island. Built by and for Christopher Billopp about 1680, this Dutch Colonial residence was for many years a center of gracious New York hospitality. It is Known also as "Conference House" because Benjamin Franklin, John Adams and Edward Rutledge met here with the English general, Lord Howe, on September 11, 1776, in an unsuccessful effort to halt the American Revolution.

Bank of New York Calendar 1967-68
729015f-a.folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY

729016f-a.text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billopp House (also called "Conference House"). It was built in 1688 by Chtistopher Billopp who aided Wew Yorkts claim to Staten Island by circumnavigating the island in hfs own vessel in less than twenty-four hours. Tn this house took place a confe ence between Howe and an American committee, composed of Adams, Franklin and Rutledge.
About 1930
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

729017f-b.text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing two views of the Billop House ('Conference House'). Here was held the conference, on September 11, 1776, between Benjamin Franklin, John Adams and Edward Rutledge representing the Continental Congress and Admiral Lord Howe, commanding the British naval
forces.

August, 1934
Views 1-2
Photos by S. Landsran

(3)
The rear of the Billop House, before it was Restored.

1924
P. L. Sperr
